items.name: Ext.mixin.Responsive
responsiveConfig
items.text: This object consists of keys that represent the conditions on which configs will be applied. For example: responsiveConfig: { landscape: { region: 'west' }, portrait: { region: 'north' } } In this case the keys ("landscape" and "portrait") are the criteria (or "rules") and the object to their right contains the configs that will apply when that rule is true. These rules can be any valid JavaScript expression but the following values are considered in scope: * `landscape` - True if the device orientation is landscape (always `true` on desktop devices). * `portrait` - True if the device orientation is portrait (always `false` on desktop devices). * `tall` - True if `width` < `height` regardless of device type. * `wide` - True if `width` > `height` regardless of device type. * `width` - The width of the viewport in pixels. * `height` - The height of the viewport in pixels. * `platform` - An object containing various booleans describing the platform (see Ext#platformTags). The properties of this object are also available implicitly (without "platform." prefix) but this sub-object may be useful to resolve ambiguity (for example, if one of the responsiveFormulas overlaps and hides any of these properties). Previous to Ext JS 5.1, the `platformTags` were only available using this prefix. A more complex example: responsiveConfig: { 'desktop || width > 800': { region: 'west' }, '!(desktop || width > 800)': { region: 'north' } } **NOTE**: If multiple rules set a single config (like above), it is important that the rules be mutually exclusive. That is, only one rule should set each config. If multiple rules are actively setting a single config, the order of these (and therefore the config's value) is unspecified. For a config to participate as a responsiveConfig it must have a "setter" method. In the above example, a "setRegion" method must exist.

items.name: responsiveFormulas
afterClassMixedIn
items.text: This class system hook method is called at the tail end of the mixin process. We need to see if the `targetClass` has already got a responsiveConfig and if so, we must add its value to the real config.

items.name: destroy
items.text: This method removes this instance from the Responsive collection.

items.name: getResponsiveState
items.text: Evaluates and returns the configs based on the responsiveConfig. This method relies on the state being captured by the updateContext method.

items.name: transformInstanceConfig
items.text:
This config system hook method is called just prior to processing the specified
"instanceConfig". This hook returns the instanceConfig that will actually be
processed by the config system.

items.name: instanceConfig
items.text: The user-supplied instance config object.

items.name: updateResponsiveState
items.text: Evaluates and applies the responsiveConfig to this instance. This is called by notify automatically.

items.name: activate
items.text:
Activates event listeners for all `Responsive` instances. This method is
called when the first instance is registered.

items.name: deactivate
items.text:
Deactivates event listeners. This method is called when the last instance
is destroyed.

items.name: notify
items.text: Updates all registered the `Responsive` instances (found in the all collection).

items.name: onResize
items.text: Handler of the window resize event. Schedules a timer so that we eventually call notify.

items.name: onTimer
items.text: This method is the timer handler. When called this removes the timer and calls notify.

items.name: processConfig
items.text:
This method is called to update the internal state of a given config since
the config is needed prior to `initConfig` processing the `instanceConfig`.

items.name: instance
items.text: The instance to configure.

items.name: instanceConfig
items.text: The config for the instance.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the config to process.

items.name: updateContext
items.text: Updates the context object base on the current environment.

items.name: all
items.text:
The collection of all `Responsive` instances. These are the instances that
will be notified when dynamic conditions change.

items.name: context
items.text:
This object holds the various context values passed to the rule evaluation
functions.

items.name: count
items.text: The number of instances in the all collection.

items.name: nextId
items.text: The seed value used to assign `Responsive` instances a unique id for keying in the all collection.
